subject: Nutrition
title: Meal Frequency for Athletes
description: A short lesson to help you apply Meal Frequency for Athletes.

hook.text: Bodybuilders eat six meals daily. Intermittent fasters eat two. Research supports both approaches.

buildup.text: Meal frequency matters less than total daily intake for body composition in most studies.

discovery.text: For athletes, spreading protein across 4 meals builds more muscle than cramming it into 2 large meals.

twist.text: Eating too frequently keeps insulin elevated all day, which can impair fat burning between meals.

climax.text: Ideal frequency depends on the sport. Endurance athletes benefit from frequent meals; strength athletes less so.

punchline.text: How often you eat matters less than what and how much.

quiz.question: For muscle building, how many daily protein feedings are optimal?
